learning.unsupervised.visualisation

Class HPCVisualizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • learning.unsupervised.visualisation.HPCVisualizer

  • public class HPCVisualizer
extends java.lang.Object
    The class that is meant to visualize the execution of Hubness-proportional clustering on MDS projections of the data.

             int numDimensions,
             int numOriginalInstances,
             int numNoisyInstances)
        Parameters:
        numClusters - Number of clusters to be used.
        numDimensions - Number of dimensions - features.
        numOriginalInstances - Number of instances to cluster.
        numNoisyInstances - Number of noisy instances to insert.

      • generateAndPrintOutTo

        public void generateAndPrintOutTo(java.io.File dir,
                         boolean useDiffColors,
                         boolean drawOnGrid)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Parameters:
        dir - Target directory for generated images.
        useDiffColors - Boolean variable indicating whether to use different colors for different classes/clusters.
        drawOnGrid - Boolean variable indicating whether to draw the results on a grid or as graph nodes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • internalPrintOut

        public void internalPrintOut(java.io.File dir,
                    boolean useDiffColors,
                    boolean drawOnGrid,
                    int k)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Parameters:
        dir - Target directory.
        useDiffColors - Boolean variable indicating whether to use different colors for different classes/clusters.
        drawOnGrid - Boolean variable indicating whether to draw the results on a grid or as graph nodes.
        k - Integer that represents the neighborhood size.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • drawAverageGridHubness

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage drawAverageGridHubness(float[][] pointXY,
                                                  int[] hubnessArray,
                                                  DataSet dset,
                                                  boolean useDiffColors)
                                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Parameters:
        pointXY - The 2D array representing projected data points.
        hubnessArray - Array of neighbor occurrence frequencies - pointwise hubness.
        dset - DataSet object.
        useDiffColors - Boolean variable indicating whether to use different colors for different classes/clusters.
        Returns:
        BufferedImage that represents hubness density of the projected data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • drawDataNodes

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage drawDataNodes(float[][] pointXY,
                                         int[] hubnessArray,
                                         DataSet dset,
                                         boolean useDiffColors)
                                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Parameters:
        pointXY - The 2D array representing projected data points.
        hubnessArray - Array of neighbor occurrence frequencies - pointwise hubness.
        dset - DataSet object.
        useDiffColors - Boolean variable indicating whether to use different colors for different classes/clusters.
        Returns:
        BufferedImage that visualizes data nodes in different sizes based on their hubness.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • drawAndPersistGBH

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage drawAndPersistGBH(float[][] pointXY,
                                             int[] goodHubnessArray,
                                             int[] badHubnessArray,
                                             DataSet dset)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Parameters:
        pointXY - The 2D array representing projected data points.
        goodHubnessArray - Array of good neighbor occurrence frequencies - pointwise good hubness.
        badHubnessArray - Array of bad neighbor occurrence frequencies - pointwise bad hubness.
        dset - DataSet object.
        Returns:
        BufferedImage that visualizes data nodes in different sizes based on their good and bad hubness.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
